title: \bfseries
description: Switch to bold series until the end of the current group or environment.

context.notes: Wrap in braces to limit scope.

title: \centering
description: Declaration to center text in the current environment.

context.notes: Affects alignment until end of group/environment.

title: \doublespacing (setspace)
description: Set double line spacing (declaration) via setspace.

title: \footnotesize
description: Set font size to footnotesize.

title: \huge
description: Set font size to huge.

title: \Huge
description: Set font size to Huge.

title: \itshape
description: Switch to italic shape until scope ends.

title: \large
description: Set font size to large.

title: \Large
description: Set font size to Large.

title: \LARGE
description: Set font size to LARGE.

title: \normalsize
description: Restore normal font size.

title: \onehalfspacing (setspace)
description: Set one-and-a-half line spacing (declaration) via setspace.

title: \raggedleft
description: Right-align (ragged left) declaration for the current scope.

context.notes: Resets at end of group/environment.

title: \raggedright
description: Left-align (ragged right) declaration for the current scope.

context.notes: Resets at end of group/environment.

title: \scriptsize
description: Set font size to scriptsize.

title: \singlespacing (setspace)
description: Set single line spacing (declaration) via setspace. Applies until the end of the current group/environment or until changed.

packages.name: setspace
packages.reason: Line spacing declarations are provided by setspace

context.notes: Placing in the preamble makes the entire document single-spaced.

title: \small
description: Set font size to small.

title: \tiny
description: Set font size to tiny until the end of the current group or environment.

context.notes: Applies within its scope (group).

title: \ttfamily
description: Switch to typewriter family until scope ends.

title: acronym (list environment, acronym pkg) environment
description: Create a list of acronyms using the acronym package.

context.notes: Alternative to glossaries' acronym support; do not mix both systems in the same document unless carefully configured.

title: algorithm (float environment, algorithm pkg) environment
description: Floating environment to wrap pseudocode (often with algorithmicx/algpseudocode inside). Provides captions and numbering like figures.

context.notes: Use together with algorithmicx/algpseudocode for the algorithm body.

title: algorithm (algorithm2e environment) environment
description: Pseudo-code environment with rich keywords and layout from algorithm2e. Supports captions, rules, and keywords like \KwData and \KwResult.

args.name: placement
args.notes: Float placement, e.g., htbp, H (with float package)

packages.name: algorithm2e
packages.reason: Provides the algorithm2e environment and keywords

context.notes: Do not mix with algorithmicx/algpseudocode in the same document unless you clearly separate styles; their syntaxes differ.

examples.name: Basic algorithm2e

custom.notes: Use \SetKw... commands to customize keywords and formatting.

title: algorithmic (algorithmicx/algpseudocode environment) environment
description: Pseudocode environment provided by algorithmicx (with algpseudocode layout). Supports commands like \State, \If, \For.

packages.name: algpseudocode
packages.reason: Provides high-level pseudocode commands and layout

context.notes: Place inside the algorithm float for captioning and numbering.

title: align environment (amsmath) environment
description: Multi-line displayed equations aligned at & with one number per line; starred form suppresses all numbering.

context.notes: Use & to set alignment points; \\ to break lines. Use \notag or \nonumber to suppress a single line number; \tag{...} for custom tags.

placeholders.defaultText:
a &= b + c \\
d &= e - f

examples.name: Basic alignment
Suppress a single number

custom.notes: Use \tag for custom labels; prefer \eqref when referencing.

title: alignat environment (amsmath) environment
description: Like align but with exact control of inter-column spacing; requires the number of alignment pairs. Starred form suppresses numbering.

args.name: n
args.notes: Number of alignment pairs per row; each row has 2n columns separated by &

context.notes: Use no extra intercolumn spacing; ensure each row has exactly 2n columns. Example row structure for n=2: a & = & b & + c.

placeholders.description: Number of alignment pairs per row

examples.name: alignat with n=2

title: axis (PGFPlots plotting environment) environment
description: Create a plot axes environment with PGFPlots. Configure labels, grid, limits, legend, and size via key–value options.

packages.name: pgfplots
packages.reason: Provides axis environment and plotting commands

context.notes: Load via \usepackage{pgfplots}, then \pgfplotsset{compat=<version>} for compatibility.

custom.notes: axis can be used outside tikzpicture if pgfplots creates one implicitly, but typical usage nests inside tikzpicture.

title: bmatrix (amsmath) environment
description: Bracketed matrix with [ ].

title: Bmatrix (amsmath) environment
description: Braced matrix with { }.

title: cases environment (amsmath) environment
description: Piecewise definitions with a left brace; use & to separate expression and condition; \\ to separate rows.

context.notes: For text in conditions, use \text{...}. Expressions are set in math style.

title: column (Beamer single column) environment
description: Create a single column inside a columns environment with a fixed width.

args.name: options
args.notes: t, c, or b for vertical alignment

context.notes: Sum of column widths should not exceed the text width (account for separations).

title: columns (Beamer columns container) environment
description: Layout content in multiple columns inside a frame.

context.notes: Use column sub-environment to create each column with a specified width.

title: corollary (amsthm environment) environment
description: Typeset a corollary with numbering and an optional title.

title: description environment
description: Description list with item-specific labels via \item[<label>]. With enumitem you can pass key–value options.

conditionalPackages.why: Optional list keys are provided by enumitem.

title: Display math: \[...\], $$...$$ (deprecated) environment
description: Display equations on their own line(s). \[ ... \] is standard; $$...$$ is TeX legacy.

context.notes: Prefer \[ \] over $$ $$ (latter is deprecated in LaTeX).

title: document environment
description: The main document body environment. All visible content belongs here.

title: enumerate environment
description: Numbered (ordered) list. With enumitem you can pass key–value options.

conditionalPackages.why: Optional list keys are provided by enumitem.

title: eqnarray environment (deprecated) environment
description: Obsolete multi-line equation array; use align or gather from amsmath instead.

context.notes: amsmath’s align is preferred.

examples.name: Obsolete alignment

title: equation environment
description: Numbered display equation. Use \label for cross-references.

context.notes: Use \label right after the equation for referencing.

title: figure environment
description: Floating figure environment for images and graphics with optional placement control.

args.name: position
args.notes: h=here, t=top, b=bottom, p=float page, !=override restrictions, H=require float package

conditionalPackages.why: H option is provided by the float package.

context.notes: Figures float to optimal positions. Prefer \centering over center environment.

title: filecontents (write a file from LaTeX source) environment
description: Create or overwrite an external file with the environment body. The starred form (filecontents*) suppresses the header/comment line.

packages.name: filecontents
packages.reason: Older documents load filecontents; modern LaTeX provides it in the kernel

context.notes: Place in the preamble before the file is needed. Some distributions allow it in the body with options, but preamble is safest.

title: flalign environment (amsmath) environment
description: Full-width alignment: leftmost and rightmost columns flush with margins. Starred form suppresses numbering.

context.notes: Typically begin and end each row with an &: e.g., & f(x)=x^2 &. Use \\ for line breaks.

title: frame (Beamer slide) environment
description: A single Beamer slide. Title and subtitle may be given as arguments or via \frametitle/\framesubtitle.

packages.name: beamer
packages.reason: Provides frame environment and slide mechanics

context.notes: Use [fragile] if the frame contains verbatim-like content.

title: gather environment (amsmath) environment
description: Multiple displayed equations centered individually, without alignment. Starred form suppresses numbering.

context.notes: Use \\ to separate lines. No alignment points are used.

title: gathered (subordinate environment, amsmath) environment
description: Subordinate multi-line environment for centered lines inside a displayed math formula. Optional [t]/[b] vertical alignment.

context.notes: Use inside equation-like displays (e.g., align, equation). Separate lines with \\

title: Inline math: $...$ / \(...\) environment
description: Inline math. Use $...$ or \(...\) to typeset mathematical expressions inside text.

context.notes: Prefer \(...\) for clarity in complex documents.

title: itemize environment
description: Unordered list. With enumitem you can pass key–value options in an optional argument.

conditionalPackages.why: Optional list keys are provided by enumitem.

title: lemma (amsthm environment) environment
description: Typeset a lemma with numbering and an optional title.

context.notes: Create with \newtheorem{lemma}[theorem]{Lemma} to share numbering with theorem.

title: longtable environment
description: Multi-page table with caption and continued headers/footers.

context.notes: Not a float; it appears in place and can break across pages.

examples.name: Basic longtable
examples.code:
\begin{longtable}{lcr}
\caption{Long table}\label{tab:long}\\
\toprule
A & B & C \\
\midrule
\endfirsthead
\toprule
A & B & C \\
\midrule
\endhead
1 & 2 & 3 \\
\bottomrule
\end{longtable}

title: lstlisting (code listing, listings) environment
description: Display code with configurable formatting (syntax-like styles, line numbers, frames).

packages.name: listings
packages.reason: Provides lstlisting environment and related commands

context.notes: To include external files, use \lstinputlisting.

title: mdframed (framed box environment, mdframed) environment
description: Create a framed box with many styling options (line color, background color, margins, rounded corners).

context.notes: Combine with xcolor for colors. For breakable boxes across pages, consider tcolorbox [breakable].

title: minipage environment
description: A box that behaves like a small page, useful for side-by-side content, figures, or tables. Supports optional vertical alignment, explicit height, and inner content alignment.

args.name: pos
args.notes: Vertical alignment of the minipage with respect to the surrounding baseline.

args.name: height
args.notes: Total height of the minipage box (optional).

args.name: innerpos
args.notes: Vertical alignment of the content within the minipage when a height is specified.

context.notes: Often used to place content side-by-side. Do not place longtable inside a minipage. Floats (figure/table) are not allowed inside minipage.

placeholders.description: Vertical alignment of the minipage (t, c, or b)
Inner content vertical alignment (t, c, or b)

examples.name: Two minipages side by side

custom.notes: Use captionof for captions inside minipage (requires caption package). Avoid longtable within minipage.

title: minted (syntax highlighted code, minted) environment
description: Display syntax-highlighted code using Pygments. Requires -shell-escape and Python with Pygments installed.

context.notes: Compile with -shell-escape; ensure Python and Pygments are available. For PDFLaTeX, UTF-8 may require encoding option.

custom.notes: If shell escape is not allowed, consider listings as a fallback.

title: multicols (multicol environment) environment
description: Typeset text in multiple balanced (default) or unbalanced (starred) columns. Use \columnbreak to force a column break.

context.notes: Balanced columns by default; multicols* creates unbalanced columns (fill columns sequentially).

custom.notes: Use \raggedcolumns before the environment to avoid uneven column bottoms if needed.

title: multline environment (amsmath) environment
description: Single long equation broken across lines; first line left, last line right; intermediate lines centered. Starred form suppresses numbering.

context.notes: Use \shoveleft and \shoveright to adjust line positioning if needed.

placeholders.defaultText:
A_1 + A_2 + \dots + A_n \\
= B_1 + B_2 + \dots + B_n

examples.name: Long sum

title: otherlanguage (babel environment) environment
description: Temporarily switch to another language for a block of text. Starred variant adjusts hyphenation/shorthands behavior.

context.notes: Good for paragraphs or sections in a different language. The starred variant has modified behavior for hyphenation/shorthands (see babel manual).

title: pmatrix (amsmath) environment
description: Parenthesized matrix. Use & to separate columns and \\ to separate rows.

context.notes: For inline-sized matrices, consider smallmatrix (not parenthesized).

title: proof (amsthm environment) environment
description: Typeset a proof. Accepts an optional name (e.g., 'Proof of Theorem 1.1'). Automatically ends with a QED symbol unless ended by display math; use \qedhere to place it within a display.

packages.name: amsthm
packages.reason: Provides proof environment and QED symbol

context.notes: Use \qedhere inside displayed equations to align the QED box at the end of the display.

title: proposition (amsthm environment) environment
description: Typeset a proposition with numbering and an optional title.

examples.name: Proposition

title: sidewaysfigure (rotated figure float, rotating) environment
description: Place a figure rotated by 90 degrees on a page, as a float.

context.notes: Use \caption and \label inside for references like a normal figure.

title: sidewaystable (rotated table float, rotating) environment
description: Place a table rotated by 90 degrees on a page, as a float.

context.notes: Use \caption and \label inside for references like a normal table.

title: split (subordinate environment, amsmath) environment
description: Subordinate alignment environment to split a single equation over multiple lines with alignment. Optional [t]/[b] vertical alignment.

context.notes: Use within equation-like displays to split one numbered equation into aligned lines. Use & for alignment; \\ for breaks.

title: subequations environment (amsmath) environment
description: Group equations under a shared parent number, producing labels like (1a), (1b), ...

context.notes: Place equation-like environments inside. Use \label after \begin{subequations} to reference the parent number.

title: subfigure environment (subcaption) environment
description: Sub-figure environment inside a figure; takes optional vertical alignment and required width.

context.notes: Place subfigures inside a figure environment.

custom.notes: Prefer subcaption over deprecated subfigure package.

title: subtable environment (subcaption) environment
description: Sub-table environment inside a table; takes optional vertical alignment and required width.

context.notes: Place inside a table environment.

title: table environment
description: Floating table environment with optional placement control.

args.name: position
args.notes: h=here, t=top, b=bottom, p=float page, !=override restrictions, H=require float package

conditionalPackages.why: H option is provided by the float package.

context.notes: Tables float to optimal positions. Prefer \centering over center environment.

title: tabular environment
description: Core table environment with column specifications (l, c, r, p{…}, and with array: m{…}, b{…}; vertical bars |; intercolumn modifiers @{}; pre/post column code >{…} <{…}).

args.name: columns
args.notes: Core: l,c,r,p{…}, |, @{}; array pkg adds m{…}, b{…}, >{…}, <{…}. siunitx adds S columns.

packages.name: siunitx
packages.reason: For S column type and number alignment.

context.notes: Use \\ to end rows; separate cells with &. Use \hline/\cline for rules; \multicolumn to span columns. \arraystretch controls row height.

placeholders.description: Rows and cells (& separates, \\ ends rows)

examples.name: Paragraph column

custom.notes: m{…} and b{…} require array. S column requires siunitx.

title: tabular* environment
description: Fixed-width tabular with adjustable intercolumn space (often using @{\extracolsep{\fill}}).

context.notes: Use \extracolsep{\fill} with @{} to distribute extra space.

title: tabularx environment
description: Like tabular, but with X columns that stretch to use the given total width.

args.name: columns
args.notes: Use X for stretchable columns; array modifiers and S allowed if packages loaded.

context.notes: X columns share remaining space according to internal algorithm.

placeholders.defaultText:
Feature & Description \\
\hline
X col & Stretches to fill width \\

title: tcolorbox (styled box environment, tcolorbox) environment
description: Highly configurable colored/framed boxes; supports titles, breakable boxes, skins, and integration with listings/minted.

packages.name: tcolorbox
packages.reason: Provides tcolorbox environment and extensive options

context.notes: Use libraries (skins, breakable, listings, minted) via \tcbuselibrary{...} for advanced features.

custom.notes: Load libraries with \tcbuselibrary for extra features.
